authors.name: shelbilrussell
authors.affiliation: Assistant Professor, Department of Biomolecular Engineering, University of California Santa Cruz

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5plk4","text":"Protocol for staining (Wolbachia-infected) Drosophila ovaries for immunolabeling germarium proteins. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"escgl","text":"Make devitellinizing (DV) solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ig7d","text":"a. Measure and add to a 1.5 ml eppendorf tube in the fume hood:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3u4jj","text":"    10x PBS 100 ul","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ut97","text":"    dH20 400 ul","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2krv6","text":"    32% EM-grade paraformaldehyde 500 ul **opened \u003c 10 days ago**","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bf6av","text":"    NP40 detergent 5.0 ul","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8j8a","text":"    ____________________","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"algnf","text":"    ~ 1 mL DV solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qiv8","text":"b. Vortex this until NP40 is no longer visible as a blob on the side of the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2fjos","text":"Dissect ovaries ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jnlj","text":"a. Set up dissecting dish, filling each well with 1xPBS ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abkud","text":"b. Label 1.5 ml eppendorf tube for each sample and fill with ~1 ml of 1x  PBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"590g7","text":"c. Knock out flies on CO2 pad","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afghg","text":"d. Sort flies for target genotypes (if needed)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ak8lk","text":"e. Dissect ovaries in PBS in 3 minutes or less to prevent “aggregation effects”. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15g1i","text":"    Note: This amounts to only 5-10 flies of one genotype.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a89e2","text":"f. Gently separate ovarioles with pins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ad39c","text":"g. Transfer ovaries to tube of 1x PBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"asqef","text":"Fix ovaries","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mje2","text":"a. Briefly spin down ovaries (at ~2500xg) and remove 1x PBS ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6o2iq","text":"    Note: ovaries may be on the side of tube - be careful to not disturb ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agnli","text":"b. In the fume hood, add 600 uL heptane to each tube and start timer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2da4n","text":"c.  Add 200 uL of DV solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"969p5","text":"d. Mix vigorously by hand for 1 min, or until emulsion forms between two phases.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vbg","text":"e. Place on rotator for remaining 19 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"127ar","text":"Rinse and treat with RNAseA (to degrade RNA for PI-DNA staining)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2a9v","text":"a. When ~30 seconds remain on the time, centrifuge ovaries briefly (at ~2500xg) to pellet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"320i4","text":"b. In the fume hood, remove and dispose the gunky top phase first, being careful to not disturb the pellet. When in doubt, remove less and add an extra wash.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qu2q","text":"c. Add ~1.2 mL 1x PBS-T (1% Triton X-100), centrifuge, pipette, and dispose residual heptane and fixative.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64ndr","text":"d. Repeat rinse once more quickly.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3k81l","text":"e. On third addition of fresh 1x PBS-T, incubate for 10 minutes prior to centrifuging and removal of buffer. Repeat two more times for a total of 5 washes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ds4pf","text":"    Thaw frozen RNAseA (10mg/ml) at room temperature","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5kql1","text":"f. After removing the final 1x PBS-T, add RNAseA ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6n833","text":"g. Incubate overnight at room temperature","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c7791","text":"Remove RNAse A","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bu9vb","text":"a. Centrifuge and remove and store RNAseA at -20C, marking use ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dt7ae","text":"    Note: RNAseA aliquots are good for up to 10 uses, with freezes in between","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ag9se","text":"b. Rinse 2x briefly and then wash 4x for 10 min each in PBS-T","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8r3jr","text":"Block tissue","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8due6","text":"Block in PBS-T with 1% (w/v) bovine serum albumin for 1 hr at room temp","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ok7a","text":"Bind primary antibody","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ceiqg","text":"a. Suspend in PBS-T containing primary antibody at proper dilution (__:_____). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"16vmc","text":"b. Incubate overnight at 4C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5bhjv","text":"Remove primary antibody","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8gck3","text":"a. Centrifuge and remove primary antibody, discarding used solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7tbkv","text":"b. Rinse 2x briefly and then wash 4x for 10 min each in PBS-T","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"abhit","text":"Bind secondary antibody","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fi3ld","text":"a. Resuspend in secondary antibody solution at proper dilution (__:_____)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1m2gp","text":"b. Incubate overnight at 4C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fjrgl","text":"Remove secondary antibody","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adnpo","text":"a. Centrifuge to remove secondary antibody, discarding used solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a27gh","text":"b. Rinse 2x briefly and then wash 4x for 10 min each in PBS-T.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9rgb","text":"Stain DNA with propidium iodide (PI)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cpujr","text":"After the removal of the last wash, add 60-100 uL of PI mounting medium to each tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5kr0m","text":"Flick to coat all oocytes in medium and spin down with the microcentrifuge to pull solution to bottom.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0379","text":"Incubate overnight at room temperature or at 4C over the weekend.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"85qt6","text":"Mount oocytes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85i0k","text":"Spin down oocytes and remove as much PI-containing mounting medium as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38gum","text":"Resuspend in 30 uL 70% glycerol in 1xPBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cls5g","text":"Using a p1000 tip, transfer each set of ovaries to a clean microscope slide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"18si","text":"Use pins to separate ovaries into ovarioles and eggs - position mature eggs around perimeter, in a circle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4s3s9","text":"Carefully lay coverslip over samples *do not move coverslip after placement (to avoid distorting oocytes).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12i95","text":"Manage the amount of mounting media under slide:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9e35f","text":"    If too much, wick excess with a kimwipe","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39pf3","text":"    If too little, add carefully with a tip to edge (allowing only what is required to fill area to wick out)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"etlvl","text":"Paint edges of coverslip with nail polish to seal sample. Allow to fully dry in a dark drawer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"49ngm","text":"Store at -20C prior to imaging. Image within a month. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5soqb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkbo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Immunolabeling and PI staining Drosophila melanogaster germaria
title_html: Immunolabeling and PI staining Drosophila melanogaster germaria

versions.title: Immunolabeling and PI staining Drosophila melanogaster germaria
versions.title_html: Immunolabeling and PI staining Drosophila melanogaster germaria
